definition: peak/summit/fig. high point/masterpiece

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
(of a mountain) high and tapered peak or summit/mountain-like in appearance/highest level/classifier for camels
old variant of 峰[feng1]

sentences.english: These developments culminated in the works of J. Bach and G. Handel .
sentences.chinese: 这一时期的种种进展在巴赫和亨德尔时达到了顶峰。

sentences.english: The frequency hit high for the first time in 1979.
sentences.chinese: 授予老朋友称号的频率在1979年达到顶峰。

sentences.english: He will push the height of the Chinese empire.
sentences.chinese: 他将汉帝国推向了壮盛的顶峰。

sentences.english: Despite having touched the pinnacle, Messi believes his best is still to come.
sentences.chinese: 尽管已经达到顶峰，梅西相信自已仍有上升空间。

sentences.english: We are always moving towards that pinnacle.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是在汲汲追求着那个所谓的顶峰。

sentences.english: The team had hiked through the night and reached Mount Rainier 's summit at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 这支队伍彻夜攀登，破晓时登上雷尼尔山的顶峰。

sentences.english: Finally we came to Almkogel, the second peak of our tour.
sentences.chinese: 最后我们到达阿尔姆科格山，此行的第二个顶峰。

sentences.english: Schubert reach the acme of his skill while quite young.
sentences.chinese: 舒伯特的技巧在他十分年轻时即已达顶峰。

sentences.english: Min smile this scene so that the highest honor in a Strange in Germany peaked in popularity.
sentences.chinese: 这一幕一笑泯恩仇让狮王在德国的人气达到顶峰。

sentences.english: Main Street is the climax of Civilization, " he warned in a prefatory note."
sentences.chinese: “大街就是文明的顶峰，”他在引言性的题词中说。

sentences.english: A: I feel I have reached the "glass ceiling" in my current job. I feel there is no opportunity for advancement.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得目前的工作，已经达到顶峰，即有升迁机会。

sentences.english: You do not have to be a professional dancer to mount an excellent performance.
sentences.chinese: 你没有必要成为一个专业的舞者登上优美表演的顶峰。

sentences.english: Amboseli sits on the lower slopes of mighty Mount Kilimanjaro - Africa's highest - whose peak lies across the border in Tanzania.
sentences.chinese: 安博西利位于非洲最顶峰乞力马扎罗山的缓坡面。

sentences.english: The novel Dead Souls marks the peak of Gogol's writing career.
sentences.chinese: 《死魂灵》是果戈里在创作上达到顶峰的标志。

sentences.english: At the pinnacle of the complex geisha ranking system are the grand dowagers of Kyoto.
sentences.chinese: 在复杂的艺妓等级系统的顶峰，是京都的“太夫”。

sentences.english: Which one not reaching the top of a successful person heart undoubtedly the swagger?
sentences.chinese: 哪一个登上成功顶峰的人心中没有傲视群雄的霸气？

definition: summit/apex/pinnacle (of one's career etc)/peak (of a civilization etc)
variant of 巔峰|巅峰[dian1 feng1]
summit/peak/(math.) vertex
flourishing period/golden age
to reach great heights (in technical skills or scholastic achievements)
flourishing age (of the ceremonial tripod)/golden age
flourishing/at its peak/a golden age
limit/extreme boundary
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
valley/trough (as opposed to peaks)/fig. low point/lowest ebb/nadir of one's fortunes
critical point/boundary point
(of a mountain) high and tapered peak or summit/mountain-like in appearance/highest level/classifier for camels
old variant of 峰[feng1]
valley floor/(fig.) lowest ebb/all-time low
most flourishing period/Golden Age
to leap to (a higher position etc)/to jump/(of a plane) to ascend
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
